intro: Taraxacum hondae, commonly known as Honduran dandelion, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Honduras. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and ragworts, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features a rosette of basal leaves that are typically hairy and lance-shaped. It produces a yellow flower head that develops into a hollow, stem-like structure with a crown of bracts, which is characteristic of the genus Taraxacum. The plant is adapted to grow in rocky and well-drained soils, often in high-altitude environments.
